newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-RTZ-CRA sees metals demand growth.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-RTZ-CRA sees metals demand growth.

text.p: Global mining group RTZ-CRA on Wednesday foreshadowed continued growth in demand for metals, saying it saw continued growth in the world economy into 1998.

Market metal prices, other than for gold, have risen strongly since their October 1996 lows, but levels of Russian exports and Chinese imports would have a major impact on the future, CRA Ltd chairman John Uhrig told the annual meeting.

"So far this year, the world economy has grown a little more strongly than it did in the corresponding period last year and it is likely that this more broadly based growth will extend into 1998," Uhrig said.
"This, of course, promises well for demand for primary raw materials."
Uhrig said, howver, that markets for the company's industrial minerals remained intensely competitive, "although there are some signs of improvement in Euroepan end-user sectors."
RTZ-CRA, a dual-listed Anglo-Australian mining group, said last month its mined production of both copper and gold rose by 12 percent in the first quarter of 1997 compared with a year ago.
